channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Fed says it's not ready to cut rates until 'greater confidence' inflation is moving to 2% goal
item.description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday released minutes from its June 11-12 meeting.

item.title: China faces economic headwinds as it grapples with an aging — and shrinking — population
item.description: Birth rates are falling around the world as women choose to have children later, or not at all.

item.title: Hong Kong's IPO market is finally starting to turn around, consulting firm EY says
item.description: The market for initial public offerings in Hong Kong is set to improve significantly over the next five years, said George Chan, global IPO leader at EY.

item.title: Biden tells ally he's weighing whether to stay in the race: Reports
item.description: The reported conversation with the ally came amid the fallout from Biden's devastating presidential debate with Trump.

item.title: Delta goes pasta-only for thousands of international travelers after 'spoiled' food forced a flight to divert
item.description: Delta said it was serving pasta only on about 75 international flights on Wednesday after a 'spoiled meal' forced an Amsterdam-bound flight to divert.

item.title: Japan's Topix hits all-time high amid broader rise in Asia-Pacific markets
item.description: The Topix crossed its all time high of 2,886.50, previously set in December 1989 as Asia markets were up in trading.

item.title: U.S. named the worst place for British families to move abroad. Here's why
item.description: The U.S. comes in last in a ranking of 28 countries, dragged down by high childcare costs, long work hours and lack of federally mandated paid parental leave.

item.title: 'We don't do God' and massive ad spends: How UK election races differ from American ones
item.description: The U.K. and U.S. have a lot in common. But when it comes to politics, Brits do things very differently from their American friends.

item.title: 'They want out': This company helps Americans experiment with expat living
item.description: Americans hoping to move abroad are getting some help from travel companies and local guides.

item.title: Vice President Kamala Harris' past donors privately strategize in case Biden drops out
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris' allies discuss scenarios in the event that President Joe Biden decides not to keep his reelection campaign going.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Tesla powers S&P 500, Nasdaq to record highs
item.description: S&P 500 and Nasdaq closed at record highs in a session ahead of the July 4 holiday. Megacap technology stocks, Tesla and Nvidia, led the charge.

item.title: McDonald's shortens breakfast hours in Australia in response to nationwide egg shortage
item.description: Australia is facing an egg supply crunch thanks to bird flu outbreaks — and it's led McDonald's to trim breakfast hours by 90 minutes.

item.title: Six NYC hotels are providing free helicopter airport transfers into the city — with one small catch
item.description: Free transfers are available from John F. Kennedy International Airport and Newark Liberty International Airport for guests staying in select suites this summer.

item.title: Is inflation Biden's or Trump's fault? The answer isn't so simple, economists say
item.description: Biden and Trump traded barbs on the state of the U.S. economy during their first debate. But who or what is really responsible for inflation?

item.title: Romance scams cost consumers $1.14 billion last year. It's a 'more insidious' fraud, expert says
item.description: Cyber criminals are tapping into wealth accounts through human connection. Here's how to spot it and cut ties as soon as you can.

item.title: Hurricane Beryl breaks records in devastating path across the Caribbean
item.description: The hurricane has set a string of records that experts say are tied to climate change, as it developed faster and much earlier in the year.

item.title: Tesla stock rises again after better-than-expected deliveries report
item.description: Tesla shares saw more gains Wednesday, after jumping 10% in the previous session.

item.title: Greece becomes first EU country to introduce a six-day working week
item.description: Greece has introduced a six-day working week for some businesses, seeking to boost productivity and employment in the southern European country.

item.title: Microsoft reaches settlement in California over claims it punished employees for taking protected time off
item.description: Microsoft has agreed to pay $14.4 million to settle claims that the company unfairly treated California employees who took protected time off.

item.title: The U.S. needs more of this critical metal — and China owns 80% of its supply chain
item.description: China dominates the supply chain for many of the world's critical minerals, but so far it's held off on sweeping restrictions on at least one: tungsten.

item.title: South Korean president announces tax breaks for companies that raise shareholder returns
item.description: These tax benefits will be given to companies that "actively expand dividends and push for [a] low-rate separate taxation on shareholders' dividend income tax."

item.title: China's BYD is set to take Tesla's crown as the world's No. 1 producer of battery electric vehicles
item.description: Counterpoint Research on Tuesday said China "remains a dominant force in the BEV market" with BYD leading the way.

item.title: Gen Zers and millennials are 'quiet vacationing' during 4th of July week instead of taking PTO
item.description: Younger employees are “quiet vacationing” during the summer months to cope with constraints on PTO and increased feelings of burnout, according to new research.

item.title: United Airlines is texting travelers live weather maps to explain flight delays
item.description: Even when it's bright and sunny, a thunderstorm hundreds of miles away can still disrupt flights.

item.title: 'It's not just Taylor Swift': ECB's Lagarde says Eras Tour is not alone in keeping euro zone inflation high
item.description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said that Taylor Swift's Eras Tour is not alone in keeping inflation high across the euro zone.

item.title: Southwest Airlines adopts 'poison pill' to fend off activist Elliott Management
item.description: Southwest adopted a shareholder rights plan to fend off an effort from activist Elliott Management to oust CEO Bob Jordan and Chairman Gary Kelly.

item.title: The 'death knell' sounded for the Conservative Party long before the UK election, polling guru says
item.description: "This is not an election about the ideological position of the parties, this is an election about competence," said the U.K.'s polling expert, John Curtice.

item.title: History suggests bitcoin will likely hit a new all-time high this year, report says
item.description: Bitcoin has not reached the top of its current cycle and is likely to go past its all-time high this year, according to a research report by CCData.

item.title: After the icy Brexit years, the UK's relationship with the EU might thaw following the election
item.description: The Labour Party says it wants to "reset" relations with the EU but doesn't want to scare swing voters away from the party.

item.title: Markets will be 'upset' if new French government does not commit to fiscal rules, European Central Bank's vice-president says
item.description: "What we have seen so far is that the evolution of [French] markets has been quite orderly," the vice president of the European Central Bank told CNBC.
